intro: Eriocephalus corymbosus, commonly known as the Cape chestnut, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces edible pods that contain seeds used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
